meta.notes: Reusable sector-level intelligence slips. Any item may be true, false, misread, or deliberate psy-ops—interpretation is the point.

cards.title: Line of Battle: Drift
cards.text: Engagement records indicate opposing forces are no longer merely reacting to pressure. Their deployments are arriving early, on the correct vectors, with unsettling consistency. No reliable predictive model has yet survived contact.

cards.title: Munitorum Drag
cards.text: Requisition fulfilment and transit cadence across the war-zone have degraded beyond acceptable variance. The cause may be sabotage, bureaucratic diversion, simple attrition, or all three acting in concert. Quartermasters advise contingency rationing.

cards.title: Overreach Advisory
cards.text: Operational momentum is outpacing consolidation. Analysts warn that continued advances may be stretching available manpower, machine, and air cover beyond sustainable limits. Gains taken without garrison become invitations.

cards.title: Resistance Beyond Estimate
cards.text: Opposition elements have demonstrated coordination and discipline inconsistent with prior assessments. This may indicate a competent guiding hand, a shared doctrine, or a common supply source previously unaccounted for.

cards.title: Vox-Lint on the Wire
cards.text: Encrypted burst-traffic of uncertain origin has been detected bleeding into sanctioned frequencies. Machine-translation yields nonsense, hymnal fragments, and repeating numeric strings. No stable decrypt has been achieved.

cards.title: Refugee Flow Reports
cards.text: Unverified accounts describe sudden civilian migration through contested routes. Motive is unclear: flight, forced relocation, false-flag manoeuvre, or opportunistic looting. Local authorities deny all knowledge (as expected).

cards.title: Choir Dissonance
cards.text: Astropathic choirs report recurring distortion during long-range sends—tones out of sequence, replies arriving before messages depart, and occasional ‘echo’ voices not belonging to any registered soul. No direct manifestation confirmed.

cards.title: Stations Gone Dark
cards.text: Multiple auspex relays have ceased reporting without the expected emergency beacons. They may be destroyed, masked, seized, or intentionally blacked out by their own crews. The silence is notable precisely because it is tidy.

cards.title: Dormant Systems Stirring
cards.text: Energy signatures consistent with large-scale activation have been recorded somewhere in-theatre. Pattern matches are inconclusive: industrial start-up, voidshield cycling, relic-grade weapon systems, or arcane power transfer. Auspex triangulation remains incomplete.

cards.title: Massing in the Shadows
cards.text: Movement logs and scattered sightings imply a concentration of hostile strength beyond normal raiding scale. Location remains uncertain; intent remains worse. Expect a strike where you least want to spare defenders.

cards.title: The Hand Behind It
cards.text: After-action reports reference a consistent coordinating presence—callsigns, symbols, or doctrine—but no confirmed identity. Whether this is a single commander, a council, or a myth being spread for morale effect is undetermined.

cards.title: Casualty Ratios: Anomalous
cards.text: Casualty and materiel-loss outcomes deviate sharply from predictive combat models. Either your intelligence is incomplete, their capabilities are underestimated, or your reporting has been ‘adjusted’ somewhere up-chain.

cards.title: Brief Window
cards.text: Recon indicates a short-lived reduction in enemy readiness—shift rotation, fuel shortage, leadership turnover, or simple exhaustion. Duration unknown; opportunity cost certain. Strike fast or not at all.

cards.title: Rival Claimants
cards.text: Intercepts hint at internal disagreement among hostile leadership elements—conflicting orders, overlapping jurisdictions, or competing agendas. Exploit the confusion, but assume it may be staged to bait overcommitment.

cards.title: Spoils Unsecured
cards.text: Survey flights and ground scouts report materiel left unclaimed after recent fighting: crates, fuel, munitions, cogitator stacks, even wounded vehicles. Whether this is negligence or a trap is unknown—either way, it is there.

cards.title: Empty Ground, Valuable Ground
cards.text: Several strategically relevant zones remain oddly uncontested—no pickets, no patrols, no formal claims. This may be oversight, fear, or deliberate vacuum meant to draw forces into a kill-box. Proceed with measured aggression.

cards.title: Doctrine Clash
cards.text: Allied detachments are operating under incompatible doctrines and command assumptions. Orders are followed ‘as written’ rather than ‘as intended,’ delaying unified response. The enemy benefits from your paperwork.

cards.title: Morale Erosion
cards.text: Extended operations are grinding down resolve across multiple units. Fatigue errors are increasing; discipline incidents are rising; prayers are getting shorter. Rotate when possible—execute when necessary.

cards.title: Cogitators Disputed
cards.text: Recent outcomes have led several commanders to question central intelligence. Some blame faulty augurs; others blame deliberate omission. Either way, trust is becoming a resource you cannot requisition.

cards.title: Requisition Collision
cards.text: High-priority demands now exceed available lift, stock, and labour. Someone will go without—possibly you. Expect political manoeuvring, reallocation orders, and ‘temporary’ confiscations by whoever has the biggest stamp.

cards.title: Victory With a Price Tag
cards.text: A recent success was accompanied by anomalous casualties, machine-spirits refusing commands, and failures that feel too synchronized to be chance. Priests offer prayers; veterans offer silence.

cards.title: The Same Battle Twice
cards.text: Analysts have noted a repeating tactical motif across unrelated engagements—similar feints, identical timings, familiar symbols in the smoke. Either someone is learning from you, or someone has been teaching them.

cards.title: Fields That Won’t Stay Quiet
cards.text: Battlefields declared cleared continue to trigger intermittent alerts: auspex pings, missing patrols, vox clicks, and motion where there should be none. The dead may be restless—or the living are simply patient.

cards.title: No Word From Above
cards.text: Expected guidance through official channels has not arrived. Interpretations vary: disruption, censorship, bureaucratic delay, or a deliberate test. The absence of orders will be filled by someone’s initiative.

cards.title: Reports in Collision
cards.text: Multiple sources describe the same event in mutually exclusive terms. Either witnesses are unreliable, records have been altered, or the truth is being split into convenient shapes for different audiences.

cards.title: Packets Out of Sequence
cards.text: Several data-bursts arrived outside expected time windows, some bearing correct seals and incorrect content. Authenticity concerns are noted; corrective action is pending; casualties will not wait.

cards.title: Morale Vox Surge
cards.text: A spike in morale transmissions has been detected across multiple channels—some crude, some disturbingly tailored. Whether it is enemy psy-ops, allied overreach, or a third party sowing chaos remains unclear.

cards.title: Confidence Is a Weakness
cards.text: Analysts caution against assumptions of imminent enemy collapse. Overconfidence is not bravery; it is an exploitable pattern. If you believe the war is already won, you will stop watching for the knife.
